question: Which of the following correctly describes the so called "harvest moon"?
option1: full moon closest to the autumnal equinox
option2: new moon closest to the vernal equinox
option3: full moon closest to vernal equinox
option4: new moon closest to autumnal equinox
answer: full moon closest to the autumnal equinox
explanation: The \"harvest moon\" is a traditional term for the full moon occurring during autumn, in the northern hemisphere usually on September 22 or 23.
